title: Can I read Amazon books without a Kindle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Of course - simply download the Kindle app from Amazon (a google search will find it immediately). This can work on pretty much any device, but for me is most comfortable reading on a tablet, but a phone is almost as good and more portable. Any Kindle books bought automatically appear on your registered app. Even better if you are reading at home on a tablet and then open the same book on the train to work the app will take you to where you left off on the other device.

Yes. You can download free Kindle software from Amazon onto your computer, laptop, tablet, or phone that will allow you read Amazon ebooks.. Although their software is based on MOBI, it is a proprietary version, so it requires the Amazon software to open the Amazon ebooks.

I am the world’s fastest reader. Yes you can download an app on your computer that decodes the books so you can read them. Learn how to read faster with excellent comprehension with some free lessons at Speed Reading Course | Read faster & change your life | Berg Learning
Yes. You can download kindle app suitable for your device with the link: iOS, Android, Mac, and PC. Create account or login to your former account and you are good to go.
